image.altText: A dead marine animal washed up along an Adelaide beach.

props.synopsis: Amid SA's devastating algal bloom, a citizen scientist says she has recorded more than 1,000 observations of dead sea creatures along a 500-metre stretch of a popular Adelaide beach in less than a fortnight.

title.children: Citizen scientist's grim report on algal bloom impact on 500m beach

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The controversial reappointment of APY Lands general manager Richard King is under a South Australian government-commissioned review following claims of a flawed recruitment process.

title.children: Reappointment of APY Lands general manager under review

image.altText: Two older women one wearing a black top and one wearing a pink top sitting at a table smiling with coffee cups in front of them.

props.synopsis: Noni Wilson, 89, is commended for putting up a fight when a stranger tried to steal a car she was sitting in outside Broken Hill Hospital.

title.children: Unable to 'flight', 89yo goes into 'fight' mode to thwart carjacker

image.altText: A waterbomber fighting the Ledge Point blaze.

props.synopsis: Longer fire seasons pose a challenge for countries in different hemispheres that traditionally lend each other a hand during disasters.

title.children: Longer fire seasons could create 'tensions' over resources

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair and a yellow, black and red scarf sits in a chair in front of windows and smiles.

props.synopsis: When more than 90,000 people marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge it created headlines across the globe. So how has the addition of more than 30 anti-protest laws across the past two decades affected demonstrating?

title.children: Have anti-protest laws changed the way young people demonstrate?

image.altText: regulator from side on with water in foreground and sky and trees in background

props.synopsis: NSW Natural Resources Access Regulator issues a stop-work order halting environmental water flows in Toorale National Park, citing a lack of mandatory reporting.

title.children: Environmental flows halted in national park over water reporting concerns

image.altText: A woman in a brown top and orange jacket stands in a shop with flowers behind her.

props.synopsis: The regional SA city's struggling smelter has received a bailout from the federal and state governments, but a resources expert says it will not be the end of Nyrstar's challenges.

title.children: Port Pirie welcomes $135m bailout but analyst warns it's no forever solution

image.altText: Charlotte Walker smiles as she sits wearing a black blazer

props.synopsis: Charlotte Walker says she has faced both misogyny and criticism in her short time as South Australian senator, but says it's all worth it to be a politician.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator says misogyny, ageist comments 'worth it'

image.altText: An artistic impression of Snowtown, including its "welcome" sign and former bank vault.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most notorious serial killers — "bodies-in-the-barrels" murderer James Vlassakis — has been approved for release from prison after 26 years. Here's a look at what happens now.

title.children: The youngest of the Snowtown killers has been granted parole. Here's what we know

image.altText: A four-wheel drive with police decals and lights outside a house

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support advocates say reaching isolated towns to help victim-survivors can be a challenge, following a murder-suicide at Bordertown.

title.children: 'Devastating' murder-suicide prompts calls for more help in isolated areas

image.altText: Two glasses of brandy are held together, toasted, man with chin, slight moustache, blue jumper.

props.synopsis: In the past, much of the grape production in South Australia's Coonawarra region was used for making brandy. Now, a local winery is producing it again.

title.children: Hopes for a brandy comeback as Coonawarra produces first branded batch

image.altText: A woman in a cream woollen jumper and blue jeans stands at a railing with a younger woman in a cap and vest.

props.synopsis: Despite battling the drought herself, South Australian farmer Bridget Woods dipped into her own superannuation to buy fodder in bulk for others in her community who are struggling to feed livestock.

title.children: Farmer dips into her super to buy fodder in bulk for drought-hit community

image.altText: A rainy day in Broken Hill in outback nsw

props.synopsis: Wet weather in July sent rainfall records tumbling in Broken Hill, bringing welcome relief to graziers who had experienced a hot and dry start to the year.

title.children: Outback NSW records wettest July in 20 years after warmest start in decades

image.altText: An AFL player celebrates a goal with a player behind him in black and red

props.synopsis: Geelong continues its push towards the finals against Essendon, while Jeremy Cameron hunts for goals in his bid to crack the ton. Follow live.

title.children: Cameron surges late as Cats overrun depleted Dons

image.altText: David Sevelle with tie

props.synopsis: Embattled startup Lightweb suspends refunds to customers indefinitely in the wake ABC reporting on its founder's identity.

title.children: 'Ethical internet' founder suspends customer refunds in crisis meeting

image.altText: A boy holding a broken surfboard.

props.synopsis: A young surfer attacked by a shark off a beach in New South Wales walks away with a "fully wrecked" board, a scratch and story to tell.

title.children: Nine-year-old escapes shark attack with scratch and a broken board

image.altText: man with very short hair wearing a light blue shirt, striped blue necktie and tailored grey collared jacket stands at mic podium

props.synopsis: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Jeremiah Manele defends his move to block almost two dozen nations from a critical Pacific meeting in Honiara next month, saying he's made a "sovereign" decision in the region's best interests.

title.children: Solomon Islands defends blocking multiple leaders from Pacific Islands Forum

image.altText: Person in a yellow dress smiling at an event with promotional signage in the background.

props.synopsis: Disney dropped Carano from the cast in 2021 over social media posts that implied being a Republican today is like being Jewish during the Holocaust.

title.children: Mandalorian actress Gina Carano settles lawsuit against Disney

image.altText: Four boys handcuffed and lying topless on the ground at night as two guards stand over them.

props.synopsis: Four former Don Dale detainees unlawfully tear gassed inside the Northern Territory's notorious youth prison will challenge cuts to their compensation in Australia's High Court.

title.children: Former Don Dale detainees to take compensation fight to High Court

image.altText: People walk past an Optus store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Optus could face another hefty penalty, as the privacy watchdog sues the telco over the 2022 cyber attack that exposed the data of around 9.5 million Australians.

title.children: 'Trillions at stake' as Optus sued for alleged data failures

image.altText: Gaypalani Waṉambi, an Indigenous woman in her late 30s, poses in front of an art work made of discarded road signs.

props.synopsis: Gaypalani Waṉambi, daughter of the late Mr Waṉambi, has won the top prize at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards, for work about an ancient honey hunter.

title.children: Art work made from discarded road signs wins $100,000 art prize

image.altText: Close up of woman legs wearing home slippers.

props.synopsis: It's that time of year when you may have found yourself searching for how to clean the clothes you only wear during winter. Look no further — here's what an expert has to say.

title.children: How to clean ugg boots, puffer jackets and other tricky winter items

image.altText: Former NSW Police officers Nathan Black wearing black hoodies and black mask, left, and Timothy John Trautsch, right, in a suit

props.synopsis: The actions of Timothy John Trautsch and Nathan Black were recorded on body-worn camera after they were called to Emu Plains following reports of a welfare check.

title.children: Ex-police officers jailed over 'gratuitous cruelty' to mentally ill woman

image.altText: Nicholas John Crilley in 2015.

props.synopsis: Nicholas John Crilley was sentenced to life imprisonment in 2020 after he pleaded guilty to more than 50 charges over the 23-day attack at a Bulimba unit.

title.children: Court throws out appeal of Brisbane man jailed for life after three week torture of woman

image.altText: dry shot of brass plaques in a hallway saying 'Children's Court' and 'Magistrates Court 2'.

props.synopsis: A woman tells a court she was scared for her life during a violent robbery by three teens at a shopping centre in Far North Queensland.

title.children: Attack by three girls leaves woman living in fear with broken spine

image.altText: Man in suit holding an umbrella with journalists beside him.

props.synopsis: After the convicted sex offender lost his bid on Thursday to stop the NSW parliament expulsion, Gareth Ward resigned from his position as minister.

title.children: 'Pretty shameful': NSW MP resigns before vote to expel him

image.altText: A doctor sitting in his office.

props.synopsis: A Hobart doctor has been fined $40,000 after being convicted of prescribing a narcotic substance without authority and issuing prescriptions for a restricted substance for more than two years.

title.children: Hobart GP convicted of prescribing controlled substance after tip-off

image.altText: Portrait of a white-breasted bird with blue cap and yellow eye against a black background.

props.synopsis: We teamed up with photographers to find out how use a smartphone to take wildlife images, snap tiny creatures, and catch birds in action.

title.children: These photos were taken with a smartphone — and you can do this too

props.synopsis: It's been a big week for the ASX 200 and investors are nearing the peak of a hair-raising psychological journey. But some are peering through their fingers, wondering what's coming next — and when?

title.children: 'Near-euphoric' investors brace for market rollercoaster plunge

image.altText: Jeremy Howe being stretchered off MCG.

props.synopsis: Veteran Collingwood defender Jeremy Howe is recovering well following a nasty collision in the Magpies' heavy defeat to Hawthorn.

title.children: Howe cleared of further injury after suffering concussion in Magpies' loss

image.altText: woman looks away bored while man in background

props.synopsis: Research shows women losing interest in sex before their male partners is less about not wanting it at all, and more about being bored of the sex on offer.

title.children: Why women in relationships with men lose interest in sex faster than their partner

image.altText: A serious-looking Carlton coach Michael Voss stares at the camera during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Carlton coach Michael Voss speaks publicly for the first time since the Blues back him to lead the club into 2026, comparing the media coverage on his future with the movie The Truman Show.

title.children: 'Hollow joy': Michael Voss speaks after getting Carlton job assurance

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's proposed cuts to US weather and climate services will cause the loss of critical data Australia relies on for its weather and climate modelling.

title.children: The storm brewing over the world's weather data could reach Australia's forecasts
